div.head: Of the Ingro≈øsing of Fines.
div.p: WHen the note of the fine is made with the Cu≈øtos breuium, if it Sect' 170. be of lands in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, or, when atturnement is made, if it be of a reuer≈øion, remainder, rents or ≈øeruices, then may it be ingro≈ø≈øed by the Chirographer.

And the Ingro≈ø≈øing of a fine, is nothing els but the entring of the coÃÑ cord Ingro≈ø≈øing thereof with the Chirographer, and the writing and deliuery of the Indentures thereof. Fitz. na. 147. a 5. H. 4. ca. 14. which be called the Chirographe of the fine, and is made in forme following, viz.

Haec e≈øt finalis concordia, facta in curia dnÃÑae Reg. apud We≈øtmÃÑ, a die
Fine en taile de reuer≈øion de rent. Pa≈øch. in 15. dies, AnÃÑ regni Eliz. &c. 39. coram Edmundo Ander≈øon. T. Walm≈øley, R. O. & R. B. Iu≈øtic' dnÃÑae Reg. & alijs fidelibus tunc ibi pre≈øentibus, inter A. B. querÃÑ, & L. C. deforc', de decem mercatÃÑ redditÃÑ cum pertinÃÑ in B. quem P. de A. tenent ad terminum vite, vnde placitum conuentionis ≈øumÃÑ fuit inter eos in ead' curÃÑ, ≈øcz. quod praed' L. conce≈ø≈øit pro ≈øe & heredibus ≈øuis, quod praed' redd' cum pertinÃÑ, quem praed' P. tenuit ad terminum vite ex dimi≈ø≈øione pÃÑd' L. in praed' vill', die, quo hec concordia facta fuit, & qui po≈øt dece≈ø≈øum ip≈øius P. ad praedict' L. & heredes ≈øuos debuit reuerti, po≈øt dece≈ø≈øum ip≈øius P. integre remaneant praedict' A. RemÃÑ as heires de corps. & hered' de corpore ≈øuo procreatÃÑ, tenend' de capital' dominis feodi illius per ≈øeruitia que ad praed' redd' pertinent imperpetuum: & ≈øi contingat, RemÃÑ as droit heires. quod idem A. obierit fine herede de corpore ≈øuo procreatÃÑ, tunc po≈øt dece≈ø≈øum ip≈øius. A. praed' redd' cum pertinÃÑ integre remanebit rectis heredibus ip≈øius A. tenend' de capitalibus dominis feodi illius per ≈øeruitia que ad praed' redd' pertinent imperpetuuÃÑ: Et pro hac conce≈ø≈øione, fine, & concordia, idem A. dedit pref. L. centum marcas argenti. And ≈øo of others according to the diuer≈øitie of their ca≈øes.

div.head: Of the Tabling of fines ingro≈ø≈øed.
div.p: The Chirographer of fines of the common plecs, for euer mu≈øt write Sect' 172. Tables. and make one table for euery county, where her Maie≈øties writ ruÃÑ neth, conteining the contentes of euery fine, that ≈øhall pa≈ø≈øe in any one terme, as the name of the County, townes, and places, wherein the tenements mencioned in any fine be, the name of y‚Ä¢ plaintife & deforceant, & of euery manor named in any fine. And the fir≈øt day of the next terme, after thingro≈ø≈øing of euery ≈øuch fine, ≈øhal fixe euery of the ≈øaid tables in ≈øome open place of the court of Common plees, and ≈øo euery day of the ≈øaid terme during the ≈øitting of the ≈øaid Court, and the ≈øaid Cirographer ≈øhall deliuer to euery ≈øheriffe of euery County, his vnder≈øherife, or deputie, faire written in parchment, a perfect content of the table ≈øo toContents. be made for that ≈øhire in the terme that ≈øhal be next before tha≈ø≈øi≈øes to be holden in the ≈øame county, or els meane betweene the terme and the ≈øaid a≈ø≈øi≈øes to be ≈øet vp the fir≈øt day & euery day of the next a≈ø≈øi≈øes in ≈øome open place of the Court, where the Iu≈øtices of a≈ø≈øi≈øes then ≈øhal ≈øit, to continue there ≈øo long as they ≈øhall ≈øit in the ≈øaid Court, if either the Chirographer or ≈øherife faile herein, he forfaiteth v. li. and the Chirographers fee, for euery ≈øuch table is iiii. d . 23. Eliz. cap. 3.

div.head: How many proclamations are to be made vpon fines, and when.
div.p: FOure proclamations onely are now to be made vpon euery fine with Sect' 172. proclamation, that is to ≈øay, one in the terme in which the fine is ingro≈ø≈øed, and in euery one of the three termes next in≈øuing the ingro≈ø≈øing thereof, one proclamation, 31. Eliz. cap. 2.

But if any of the ≈øame proclamations faile, by rea≈øon of the adiornement AdiournemeÃÑt. of any of the ≈øaid termes by writ of adiournement duely made, yet is ≈øuch fine good, and a good fine with proclamations, as if the ≈øame had bin proclaimed, 1. Mar. ca. 7.
Bu if any proclamation be made vpon a ≈øunday, it is error, becau≈øe it Sundaies is not dies Iuridicus, Dyer fo. 128. pl. 53. 55. 2. Eliz.

div.head: Of Proclamations of fines at the a≈ø≈øi≈øes and general Se≈ø≈øions how they mu≈øt be certified.
div.p: TO the end better notice of fines may come to them, to whom it appertaineth, Sect' 173. Se≈ø≈øions it is ordained by the ≈øaid ≈øtatute of 4. H. 7. ca. 24. That the Iu≈øtices of the common place ≈øhall ≈øend a tran≈øcript of ≈øuch fines to the Iu≈øtices of a≈ø≈øi≈øes in the counties where the lands doe lie, to be proclaimedA≈ø≈øi≈øes. openly and ≈øolemnly at all the a≈ø≈øi≈øes, which ≈øhalbe there in holden, within one yere after the Ingro≈ø≈øing of ≈øuch fines: And that the like Tran≈øcript be made to the Iu≈øtices of the peace, there to be proclaimed at foure generall Se≈ø≈øions in the ≈øaid Counties, and both the ≈øame proclamations to be made and certified into the common place the ≈øecond day of the returne of the terme then next following: And it is to be noted, That while the ≈øaid fines are read, all plees mu≈øt cea≈øe, 4. H. 7. cap. 24.

The forme of euery ≈øuch proclamation is thus: After the crier hath Proclamation. made an O yes for ≈øilence, ≈øaying: O yes, les fines lies, or to that effect, the Cirographer or his deputie, readeth the fines thus:
EborÃÑ. A Fine with proclamations betweene A. B. plaintife, and C. D. deforciant of tenements, in D. &c.

If the cogni≈øees in fines die, before thingro≈ø≈øing thereof, no Proclamations Cogni≈øe ‚Ä¢ dead. ≈øhalbe made, becau≈øe they had their election to haue y‚Ä¢ fine with proclamations or without, which election is now by their death determined, Dier fo. 254. pl. 104. 8. Eliz. Plow. fo. 266. b.

div.head: Of the Inrolement of all the parts of fines after the ingro≈øsing thereof and Proclamations pa≈ø≈øed.
div.p:
BY the Statute of 23. Eliz. ca. 3. it is ordeined, that there ≈øhall be for Sect' 174. Office of Inrolment of fines &c. euer and office of Inrolment, called the office of Inrolments of fines & recoueries: And the Iu≈øtices of the common pleas, for the time being, other then the chiefe Iu≈øtice, ≈øhall haue & take the care & charge of & for
the Inrolments afore≈øaid, ≈øee the examinations thereof, and write their names vnto the rolles thereof, & haue & enioy the ≈øaid office & the di≈øpo≈øition thereof, & carefully ≈øee & looke to thexecution therof. And haue for the Inrolment & examination of euery ≈øuch fine vi. s. viii. d .
And for euery exemplification of euery ≈øuch Inrolment of any fine v. Exemplification. sÃÑ. for one yeres ≈øearch iiii. d . for euery ≈øheete of paper conteining xiiii. lines iiii. d .

And the Iu≈øtices of the common place haue power to take order in all things conuenieÃÑt for the ≈øaid Inrolments, and vpon examination in the ≈øaid court to a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øe fines and amerciaments vpon per≈øons offending, forPuni≈øhment. their mi≈øpri≈øions, contempts, or negligences for not doing or mi≈ødoing of any thing, of, in, or concerning any ≈øuch fines, as they ≈øhall think meet and conuenient, 23. Eliz. ca. 3.

And euery writ of Couenant, and other writ, whereupon any fine is Inrolment of fines. leuied, the returne therof, the Dedimus pote≈øtatem made for the knowledging thereof, the returne thereof, the concord, the note, and foote of euery ≈øuch fine, the proclamations made thereupon, and the kings ≈øiluer, vpon the reque≈øt or election of any per≈øon, may bee inrolled in the ≈øaid office: And the Inrolments of the ≈øame, or of any part thereof, ≈øhalbe of as good force and validitie in the Law to all intents, for ≈øo much of any of them ≈øo inrolled, as the ≈øame being extant and remayning were or ought by Law to be, 23. Eliz. cap. 3.

div.head: Of the exemplification of the parts of fines inrolled.
div.p: VVHen any of the parts of a fine be inrolled according to the ≈øaid Sect' 175. ≈øtatute, then may the ≈øame be exemplified, either vnder the ≈øeale of thoffice, or vnder the great ≈øeale of England: But to exemplifie ≈øuch a fine vnder the great ≈øeale hath this di≈øcommoditie, that if any errours remaine in the record of the ≈øame fine, they be not amendable after the exemplification thereof, 23. Eliz. ca. 3. but it ≈øeemeth this extendeth only to fines leuied before the ≈øame ≈øtatute of 23. Eliz. ca. 3.

The≈øe Inrolements and exeÃÑplifications ≈øeeme very nece≈ø≈øary, becau≈øe that by the priuity and warrant of the ≈øaid Court, many errors happening in the former records thereof may be amended, and the≈øe Inrolements will ≈øuffice, if the former record thereof or any part therof, be imbe≈øelled or otherwi≈øe defaced, 23. Eliz. cap. 3.

body.head: The Exemplification of a fine inrolled according to the ≈øtatute of 23. Eliz. ca. 3.

div.head: How fines executory be executed.
div.p: THe execution of a fine, is the obtaining of actuail po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the Sect. 176 things conteined in the ≈øame, by vertue thereof, and it is either by entree into the lands, or by writ.

By entree into the landes, as if vpon a fine ≈øur cognizance de droit come ceo que il ad de ≈øon done, If the cognizor remaine ≈øtill in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, And the cognizee by vertue of ≈øuch fine enter vpon him, as he lawfully may, without any writ of habere fac' ≈øei≈øinam, becau≈øe ≈øuch fine is executed, 41. E. 3. 14. 42. Edw. 3. 5. And if fine be leuied to the hu≈øband and wife in ≈øpeciall tayle, the remÃÑ to the heires of the body of the hu≈øband, and the wife dieth without i≈ø≈øue, the remainder is executed in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øioÃÑ in the hu≈øband, for the e≈øtate taile meeteth with the freehold and drowneth it. 7. H. 4. 23.

div.head: Execution of fines by writ.
div.p:
EXecution of fines by writ, is either by Habere facias ≈øei≈øinam, or by
Sect. 177. Scire facias.

A writ of Habere facias ≈øei≈øinam, in this ca≈øe is a writ iudiciall, i≈ø≈øuing out of the Record of a fine executory, directed to the Sheriffe of the countie where the land lieth, commaunding him to giue the cognizee or his heires ≈øei≈øin of the land, whereof the fine is leuied, And this writ lieth within the yeare, after the fine, or, iudgement vpon a Scire facias. And may be made in the≈øe formes.

div.head: Of Execution of fines by Scire facias.
div.p:
A Writ of Scire facias vpon a fine, lieth in the ≈øame ca≈øe that a writ
Sect. 178. of Habere facias ≈øei≈øinam doth, ≈øauing that it is to be ≈øued a yeare and a day after the fine is leuied, whereby the Shirife is commaunded to warne the terre tenant to appeare, and ≈øhew cau≈øe if he can, why the Cogni≈øee or his heires ≈øhould not haue execution, At the returne where of, if the tenant appeare, and ≈øhew no cau≈øe to the contrarie, the plaintife ≈øhall haue an Habere facias ≈øei≈øinam, vt ≈øupra. And the forme of diuers Scire facias in like ca≈øe en≈øue:

Et praed' E. dicit quod ip≈øe natus fuit & procreatus fuit infra de≈øpon≈øalia inter praed' W. et M. celebrata, videlicet apud M. in predict' comÃÑ E. & hoc vt prius paratus e≈øt verificare per patriam de pred‚ñ™ comÃÑ E. & qualitercuÃÑ que cu ‚Ä¢ hic con≈ø. & quia videtur curie hic quod exitus placiti praed' per homines de vtroque comitatu pred' tr ‚Ä¢ ari debet, Ideo prec' e≈øt vtri≈øqueTrial. vicecomÃÑ comÃÑ pred' quod vterque eorum venire faciÃÑat hic tali die, duodecimo &c. per quos &c.

que I. A. & P. iuxta debitÃÑ premunic' virtute dictio breuis no≈øtri ≈øibi factÃÑ, coram nobis coÃÑ parentes allegauerunt ip≈øum I. fore ba≈øtard', hoc pretendendo verificare, & quia huiu≈ømodi cau≈øe cognitio ad forum mere ≈øpectat eccle≈øia≈øtic' vobis mandamus, quod vocatÃÑ coram vobis, quos in ea parte fore videritÃÑ euocand', diligentÃÑ inde faciatÃÑ inqui≈øitionem, & plenariam veritatem inde per literas ve≈øtras ≈øub ≈øigillo ve≈øtro ≈øigillatÃÑ nobis in oct' &c. vbicuÃÑ que tunc fuerimus in Angl', reddatÃÑ certiores in hoc breue nobis tunc remittentes. Te≈øte &c.

ReturnÃÑ ≈øci. fec‚ñ™ predictus I. H. in propria Íùë≈øona ≈øua, & vic' mand' qd' ≈øcire fecerÃÑ eideÃÑ I. H. e≈ø≈øendi hic ad hunc diem &c. o≈øten≈øurÃÑ in formÃÑ pÃÑd' per N. B. &c. probosI. to whom the pl' maketh him≈øelfe heire was ≈øei≈øed, who≈øe e≈øtate the ten ‚Ä¢ t hath‚ñ™ &c. & ≈øuper hoc pÃÑd' I. E. petit ver≈øus praed' I. H. executionem &c. Et praed' I. H. dic' quod pÃÑd' I. B. execuc' de me≈ø≈ø‚ñ™ pÃÑd' cum ÍùëtinÃÑ virtute finis praed' ver≈øus eum habere non debet, quia dicit quod ead' I. fuit ≈øei≈øita de ei≈ødem me≈ø≈ø. cum ÍùëtinÃÑ in dnÃÑico ≈øuo vt de feodo talliato virtute finis illius, cuiÍù∞ quid' I. ≈øtatuÃÑ praed' I. H. modo habet in me≈ø≈øuagijs illis cum ÍùëtinÃÑ, & ≈øic dicit quod finis praed' executus fuit in per≈øona praed' I. Íùë ≈øei≈øinam ≈øuam virtute finis illius, & hoc paratus e≈øt verificare, vnde petit iudicium ≈øi pÃÑd' I. B. execuc' me≈ø≈ø. pÃÑd' cum ÍùëtinÃÑ virtute finis praed' in formÃÑ pÃÑd' executi in hoc ca≈øu ver≈øus euÃÑ habere debeat &c. & pÃÑd' I. B. dicit qd' qd' ip≈øe ab execuc' me≈ø≈ø. pÃÑd' cum ÍùëtinÃÑ ver≈øus pref. I. H. habenƒë Íùë aliqua pÃÑallagata excludi non debet. Quia dicit quod praed' I. non fuit ≈øei≈øita de praed me≈ø≈ø. cum ÍùëtinÃÑ virtute finis praed', in forma qua preƒë I. H. ≈øuperius allegauit, & hoc petÃÑ quod inquiratÃÑ per patriam, & pred' I. H. ≈øimiliter, Ideo xij. &c.

Et praedict' T. R. quoad octo acrÃÑ bo≈øci cum pertinentijs in praed' villa de H. vnde executio modo ≈øecuta e≈øt ver≈øus eum, dicit quod praedict' R. et H. qui fuerunt partes fini praed', tempore leuationis eiu≈ød' finis, ante, ≈øeu, po≈øt, nihil habuerunt in eodem bo≈øco cum pertinentijs vnde &c. vt de libero tenemento, immo quedam I. M. tunc fuit inde ≈øei≈øita in dominico ≈øuo vt defeodo, cuius quid I. ≈øtatum inde, praedict' T. R. modo habet, & die impetrac' praedict' breuis de Scirefacias habuit in bo≈øco illo cum pertinentijs, & hoc paratus e≈øt verificare, vnde petit iudicium ≈øi praed' P. fil' P. executionem earund' octo acrarum bo≈øci cum pertinentijs virtute finis praedict' in hoc ca≈øu ver≈ø. eum habere debeat &c. Et quoad praed' centum ≈øolidatos redditus cum pertinentijs in eadem villa de H. vnde executio ≈øimiliter modo ≈øecuta e≈øt, idem T. vlterius dicit, qd' ip≈øe non e≈øt inde tenens preceptor neque deforc' redditus illius cum pertinentijs, neque tenens tenementorum, vnde idem redditus cum pertinÃÑ prouenÃÑ, vt de libero tenÃÑto, nec fuit die impetrac' pred' breuis de Scire facias aut vnquam po≈øtea, Et hoc paratus e≈øt verificare, vnde quoad redditÃÑ illum cu pertinÃÑ, pe ‚Ä¢ iudiciuÃÑ de breui &c. et praed' P. fil' P. quoad dictuÃÑ redditum centum ≈øolid', dicit quod die impetrationis breuis ≈øui de Scire facias, ≈øcilicet die &c. anno &c. praedict' T. R. fuit tenens vt de libero tenemento de viginti acris terre cum pertinentijs in praedicta villa de H. vnde redditus ille cum pertinentijs prouenit, Et dicit q ‚Ä¢ od idem T. tunc fuit deforc' eiu≈ødem redditus cum pertinentijs vt de libero tenemento, prout per idem breue ≈øupponitur: Et petit ≈øuo periculo executionem eiu≈ødem redditus cum pertinentijs ver≈øus eum adiudicari &c. Ideo &c. quoad redditum illum cum pertinentijs, con≈ø. e≈øt quod praedictÃÑ P. filius P. habeat inde executionem ≈øuo periculo ver≈øus prefatÃÑ T. R. virtute finis praedict' &c. Et quoad praedict' octo acras bo≈øci cum pertinÃÑ, vnde &c. idem P. fil' P. dicit, quod tempore leuationis finis praedict', praed' T. & G. qui fuerunt partes fini illi, fuerunt ≈øei≈øiti de eod' bo≈øco cum pertinentijs vnde &c. in dnÃÑico ≈øuo vt defeodo &c, prout per ‚Ä¢ undem finem ≈øupponitur, Et hoc petit quod inquiratÃÑ per patriam et pÃÑd' T. R. ≈øimilit', Ideo quoad hunc exitum xij. &c.

R. de centum ≈øolid' redditus cum pertinÃÑ in H. virtute cuiu≈ød' finis icde leuatÃÑ in curia domini E. quondam Regis &c. apud W. in oct' &c. anno &c. coram W. B. et ≈øocijs ≈øuis tunc Iu≈øticiarijs eiu≈ødem &c. de Banco, inter R. &c. querÃÑ et T. P. et B. vxoreÃÑ eius deforc', de redditu praed' cum pertinenÃÑ, ac de alijs terris et tenÃÑtis in eodem fine contentis per defaltÃÑ &c. Et ideo tibi precipimus, quod eidem P. de redditÃÑ praed' cum pertinÃÑ ≈øine dilatione plenarÃÑ executionem et ≈øei≈øinam habere facias T. &c.

Scias quod con≈ø. e≈øt in curÃÑ &c. quod R. filius et heres R. habeat ≈øei≈øinam
& execuc' ver≈øus R. D. de manerio de A. cum pertinenÃÑ in comÃÑ tuoHeÃÑre fac' ≈øei≈øinam ≈øur recouery ≈øur defaltÃÑ in ≈øcire fac'. per defaltÃÑ praedict' R. virtute note cuiu≈ødam finis nuper leuati in curia praedictÃÑ R. nuper Regis &c. apud W. a die &c. anno &c. coram R. B. & ≈øocijs ≈øuis Iu≈øticiarijs praedict' nuper Regis de banco, et po≈øtea in oct. &c. anno &c. ibidem conce≈ø≈ø. et recordatÃÑ coram ei≈ødem Iu≈øticiarijs & alijs eiu≈ødem nuper regis fidelibus tunc ibi prae≈øentibus, inter R. de A. &c. querÃÑ, & I. de S. & E. vxorÃÑ eius deforciantÃÑ, de manerijs de O. et R. cum pertinentijs in comÃÑ N. et de praedict' manerio de A. in comitatÃÑ tuo, & ideo tibi praecipimus, quod eidem R. fil' R. de praedict' manerio de A. cum pertinenÃÑ ≈øine dilatione plenarÃÑ ≈øei≈øinam et executionem habere facias T. &c.

Po≈øtea die et loco &c. venit R. W. infranominatÃÑ in propria per≈øonÃÑ Receite of a feme couert vpon her hu≈øbands defalt. ≈øua, et W. N. infranominatÃÑ ≈øolemniter exactus non venit, ≈øed I. vxor eiu≈ød' W. infranominatÃÑ in propria per≈øona ≈øua venit, et dicit quod maneria infra ≈øpecificatÃÑ ≈øunt ius ip≈øius I. et quod ip≈øa parata e≈øt o≈øtendere, quod praedictÃÑ R. W. executionem de manerijs illis virtute finis infra≈øcriptÃÑ habere non debet, vnde ex quo venit ante iudicium redd' parata praefatÃÑ R. inde re≈øponderÃÑ & ius ≈øuum defenderÃÑ, petÃÑ quod ip≈øa per defalt. praef. div.head: Certaine ca≈øes of the nature and forme of a Sci. Fa. vpon a fine.
div.p: ANd a Scire fac. to execute a fine, mu≈øt agree with the fine, and then Sect. 179. Surplu≈øage. it is not materiall, if one thing be twi≈øe demaunded thereby, as a maner and a hundred parcell of the ≈øame maner, 27. H. 8. 2.
A Scire facias may be ≈øued vpoÃÑ the note of the fine, before it be ingro≈ø≈øed Vpon the note. by the Cirographer, 22. H. 6. 13.
But of a fine leuied before time of memory, a man ≈øhal not haue execution A fine before memorie. by Scire facias, 1. E. 4. 6. ContrÃÑ 16. H. 7. 9.

Where a fine executory is leuied of a Seigniory, if the land e≈øcheat, Of land in lieu of the ≈øeruices. or the tenant be foriudged &c. the Cognizee ≈øhall haue a Scire facias of the land in lieu of the ≈øeruices, 48. E. 3. 11.
A Mittimus maketh no mention whether the fine be ingro≈ø≈øed or no, but, cum quidam finis leua≈ø≈øet &c. 22. H. 6. 13.

If a fine be leuied to A. in taile, the remainder to B. in taile, the remainder to C. in fee: And the record is ≈øent into the Chauncerie, and the fir≈øt tenant in taile dyeth without i≈ø≈øue, and the record commeth backe into the Bench by Mittimus, at the ≈øuit of him in the fir≈øt remainder, and thereupon he had a Scire facias to execute the fine, & died without i≈ø≈øue before execution had, he in the remainder in fee ≈øhall not hereupon haue a Scire facias, without a new coÃÑmaundement, becau≈øe the record was once out of the Court, & came againe at the ≈øuit of him in the
fir≈øt remainder, vnto whom he in the remainder in fee is an e≈øtranger, yet thi≈ø≈øue of him, which remoued the record in this cau≈øe, might haue a Scire facias, without any new commaundement, becau≈øe he is priuie, 14. H. 7. 16. 9. E. 4. 15. 11. E. 4. 13.
If two ≈øue a Scire fac' to execute a fine, & the one dieth, the ≈øur ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ or ≈øhal haue a Scire fac' without any new commaundement, 1. E. 4. 13.

But if diuers per≈øons, as heires vnto A. B. pray a Scire fac' it is not grauntable, vntill they haue ≈øued ≈øeueral writs to the Iu≈øtices of the bench, coÃÑmaunding them to make execution, 11. E. 4. 13. T. 21. E. 4.

In a Scire facias to execute a fine, as co≈øin and heire to him in the remainder Coment co≈øin & heire. or reuer≈øion, after the death of the particuler tenant, the plaintife needeth not to ≈øhew how co≈øin and heire, ≈øo long as the plea hath continuance by Idem dies &c. giuen to the tenant, nor at his appearance, nor vntill the plaintife pray execution: And then the coment co≈øin & heire, is to be entred thus in the Roll onely: Et praedictus I. dicit quod ip≈øe e≈øt con≈øanguineus & haeres I. W. videlicet, filius & haeres T. W. fratris & haeredis eiu≈ødem I. W. 33. H. 6. 54. 41. E. 3. 13. & 24. 8. H. 4. 31.

In Scire facias by him in the remainder vpon an e≈øtate tayle vers A. Ba≈øtardy. B. ≈øuppo≈øing the donee to be dead without i≈ø≈øue, if A. B. plead that he is i≈ø≈øue to the donee, and the plaintife replieth that he is a ba≈øtard, it is a good replication, 40. E. 3. 16.

Scire facias vpon a fine leuied to T. R. and W. and to the heires of Vpon e≈øtate executed. the bodie of R. the remainder to the right heires of the ≈øaid W. T. died, and R. died without i≈ø≈øue, and W. ≈øuruiued and died, his heires need no Scire facias to execute this fine, becau≈øe it is executed in his life, by the vnion of the fee and franktenement in W. 40. E. 3. 20. And ≈øo if a fine be leuied to baron & feme, and to W. and his heires, & he dieth, and then the baron and feme do die, the fine is executed for one moitie in the life of W. Fitz h. Scire fac' 19. 42. E. 3. 9. 24. E. 3. 57.

Tenant for life in Scire facias had ayde of him in remainder, 41. E. 3.
Ayd ‚Ä¢ . fol. 16. and 20. 22. E. 3. 12.

In Formedon in Reuerter or Remainder, the demandant mu≈øt meÃÑ cion Death ≈øhewed the death of euery one, which had e≈øtate and ≈øuruiued his aunce≈øter. But not ≈øo in a Scire facias ≈øur fine, 42. E. 3. 19.

If the plaintife haue ≈øeuerall e≈øtates created by one fine, needeth but Seuerall e≈øtates. one writ of Scire fac'. 43. E. 3. 11. though it be of ≈øeuerall things again≈øt ≈øeuerall tenants, 11. H. 4. 15. 21. E. 3. 14. 24. B. 3. 25.
If in a Scire facias the Shirife cetorne the partie ≈øummoned, and he Default. appeare not, execution ≈øhall be awarded, 43. E. 3. 13. ‚Ä¢
If a fine ≈øur cognizance de droit come ceo &c. be leuied of a reuer≈øion Reuer≈øion. by the name of the land, it is not executory, 43. E. 3. 15.
If the ≈øeruices e≈øcheat after a fine leuied of the ≈øeigniory, the Cognizee Seigniory. ≈øhall haue execution of the land e≈øcheated, 48. E. 3. 11.
A Scire fac' lieth ≈øometimes of things not compri≈øed in the writ: as Of things ou ‚Ä¢ of the writ. if in a fine ≈øur releas, the Cognizee render rent in taile, 49. E. 3. 8.

If land be giuen by fine for life, the remainder to baron & feme in Execution by entrie of him in remainder. tayle, & the baron dieth, & then the tenant for life dieth, and the feme entreth, the fine is execute, ≈øo as their i≈ø≈øue needeth no Sci. fac' 49. E. 3. 12.
Scire facias lieth for the donor in taile again≈øt any that abateth after Of a Reuer≈øion. the death of the donee in taile by fine without i≈ø≈øue, 22. E. 3. 12.
Vpon general Nontenure pleaded, the plaintife may take executioÃÑ at Nontenure general or ≈øpecial. his peril: But ≈øpecial Nontenure ≈øeemeth a good plea, 7. H. 6. 25.
A man ≈øhall not haue execution vpon nihil retorned, becau≈øe the tenant Nihil retorned. may be ≈øummoned in the land demaunded, 24. E. 3. 25.

If a fine be leuied to hu≈øband and wife in taile, the remainder to his Demy ≈øank. right heires, & they hauing i≈ø≈øue, the hu≈øband dieth, the wife hath i≈ø≈øue by another hu≈øband and dieth, thi≈ø≈øue by the fir≈øt hu≈øband, entreth and dieth without i≈ø≈øue and his next heire entreth as into the remainder in fee, again≈øt whom the i≈ø≈øue by the ≈øecond hu≈øband bringeth a Scire fac', and recouereth, by rea≈øon that the fee could neuer execute in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, in thelder brother, during the ≈øtate tailly, 24. E. 3. 30. & 62.
Feoffement with warranty from the plaintifes aunce≈øtor is a good Feoffement‚ñ™ plea in Scire facias vpon a fine, 22. H. 6. 39.
The heire ≈øhall haue his age in Scire fac' ContrÃÑ We≈øtmÃÑ 2. cap. 45. 24. E. 3. 29. & 60.

div.head: What fines with proclamations barre not thi≈ø≈øue in taile.
div.p: NO fine leuied by tenant in taile barreth his i≈ø≈øue maintenant, but Sect. 180. where the tenant in taile is cognizor, as if tenant in tayle bring a writ of Couenant again≈øt an E≈øtranger, and recognize the land to be the right of the tenant in taile, as that which he hath of his gifte &c. and the tenant in taile graunt and render the land to the cognizor for yeares, yeelding rent &c. & die, this fine is void again≈øt thi≈ø≈øue in taile. M. 10. & 11. Eliz. Dyer f. 279. p. 7. 36. H. 8. Br. fines 118.

A fine with proclamation leuied by tenant in taile, the reuercion or remainder being in the king, bindeth not thi≈ø≈øue in tayle, as it ≈øeemeth. Br. fines. 121. But if ≈øuch lands weare entailed by the king, ≈øuch fine barreth not thi≈ø≈øue in tayle. 32. H. 8. ca. 36.

If an E≈øtrÃÑ leuie a fine to tenant in taile ≈øur cognizanee de droit come ceo que il ad de ≈øon done, and he render to him a rent in fee, and die after proclamation, yet thi≈ø≈øue in taile may auoid it, for he is remitted, and the rent is another thing then the land. 15. Eliz. Plo. fol. 435. b. per Thornton.
If tenant in tayle of an aduow≈øon, graunt and rendre by fine the nomination of the Clerke, it is void. 15. Eliz. Pl. f. 435. b. Íùë Thornton.

If tenant in taile of a rent di≈ø≈øei≈øe the tenant of the land, and leuie a fine with proclamacion of the land, thi≈ø≈øue in taile is not barred for the rent, becau≈øe the fine was not leuied of the rent but of the land, per Thornton, and granted 15. Eliz. Plo. f. 435. b.
If tenant in taile graunt a rent by fine, his i≈ø≈øue may auoid it. 15. Eliz. Plow. 436. 14. a≈ø≈ø. p. 4.

div.head: What time after a fine leuied, and proclamation made, any man hath to enter or claime by action, or otherwi≈øe, & who are therby barred forthwith, and who not.
div.q: Hetherto of the formes and execucion of fines, now let ≈øee how they may be auoided.
div.p: TO know what time, Íùë≈øons, that haue cau≈øe to enter or claime, may Sect. 181. enter or claime, after a fine leuied, many things are to be weyed: for ≈øome Íùë≈øons haue more time, & ≈øome le≈ø≈øe: for the di≈øcu≈ø≈øing of which que≈øtion, we mu≈øt not onely con≈øider the qualitie of the per≈øons, which ≈øhould claime or enter, but al≈øo the qualitie of their rights and e≈øtates: And the par≈øons be either ≈øuch, as are void of impediments, or ≈øuch as haue impediments: And the ≈øame be either parties, or, priuies to the fine, or, e≈øtrangers to the ≈øame. And againe, they haue either pre≈øent right, or, future right: And vnto tho≈øe which haue future right, ≈øuch haue the ≈øame, either wholly after the fine, or, partly before, and partly after: And ≈øome of them, haue, but one title, and ≈øome diuer≈øe: And, others haue no right to the tenements compri≈øed in the fine, but to ≈øome things therein, or, i≈ø≈øuing out of the ≈øame.

Parties to fines, void of impediments at the time of the leuying of Parties. the ≈øame, and their heires, are thereby barred pre≈øently, & haue no time at all, to auoid the ≈øame, by entree, or claime, 1. R. 3. ca. 7. 4. H. 7. c. 24. whether they be per≈øons, hauing naturall capacities, or, ciuill.

If they be ≈øuch ciuill bodies, or, corporations, as haue in them≈øelues ab≈øolute e≈øtate and authoritie of their po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions, ≈øo as they may maintaine a writ of Right thereof, as, Maior and Comminaltie, Deane and Chapter, Colledges, ≈øocieties corporate, & ≈øuch like, & their ≈øucce≈ø≈øors, are barred by fines pre≈øently. Plow. 338. a. T. 20. Eliz.

But, Deanes, Bi≈øhops, Priors, Abbots, Ma≈øters of Ho≈øpitals, Par≈øons, Uicars, Prebendaries, Chauntrie Prie≈øtes, and ≈øuch like, which may not haue a writ of Right, but either a Iuris vtrum, Fitzh. Nat. fol. 48. r. or, ≈øine a≈ø≈øen≈øu capituli: Fitz. Nat. fol. 118. i. are not barred by ≈øuch fines if the patron and ordinarie ioine not with them. Plow. 538. a 20. Eliz. 375. b. 11. Eliz.

div.head: How priuies in bloud, are bound in fines.
div.p: ANd by the ≈øame ≈øtatuts 1. R. 3. c. 7. 4. H. 7. c. 24. Priuies in bloud, Sect. 182. Priuies. as heires of the cognizours, claiming by the ≈øame title, that their ance≈øter had, that leuied the fine, be barred pre≈øently thereby, whether they be void of impedimeÃÑts, or no. As if lands of Socage tenure, be giuen to baron & feme, in ≈øpecial taile, the remainder to the right heirs of the baron in fee, & the baron ≈øole leuieth a fine with proclamatioÃÑ to his owne v≈øe in fee, & after deui≈øeth the ≈øame lands to A. in fee, & hath i≈ø≈øue, & then the baron & feme die, thi≈ø≈øue in taile is barred, becau≈øe he can not otherwi≈øe conuey him≈øelfe to the title and di≈øcent in taile, then as heire of the bodie doth of his father and mother. Tr. 18. Eliz. Dyerf. 251. p. 24. 9. H. 8. Dier f. 3. p. 6. 32. H. 8. Br. Fines 109.

So if hu≈øband & wife, tenants in ≈øpeciall taile, haue i≈ø≈øue, & the wife Priuies. die, & the hu≈øbaÃÑd marrie an other wife & haue i≈ø≈øue, & leuie a fine ≈øur cognizance de droit come ceo &c. and by the ≈øame fine take e≈øtate in ≈øpecial taile, the remainder ouer &c. & die, thi≈ø≈øue by the fir≈øt wife, is barred, becau≈øe he is priuie in bloud, the coÃÑtinuance of the po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion in the hu≈øband notwith≈øtanding, 32. E. 3. Dyer pla. 16. Eliz. f. 334. p. 31. & 32.

But if my fathers brother di≈ø≈øei≈øe him, and leuie a fine with proclamation, & my father and my vncle within fiue yeares after proclamatioÃÑ die, yet may I auoid it by entre, at any time before thend of the ≈øaid fiue yeares, not with≈øtanding that I am priuie in bloud vnto mine vncle, for that my title to the land groweth by my father, and not as heire vnto mine vncle, P. 19. H. 8. Dyer fol. 3. p. 2.

Neuerthele≈ø≈øe, if my father di≈ø≈øei≈øe my graund father of an e≈øtate in Priuies. fee, and thereof leuie a fine with proclamation, & fir≈øt my graundfather, and then my father die, I am now barred, as priuie, becau≈øe I cannot otherwi≈øe conuey my ≈øelfe to the lands, then as their vnto my father the Cognizor, P. 19. H. 8. Dyer fol. 3. p. 3.

div.head: Of E≈øtraungers hauing pre≈øent right, and no impediment.
div.p: BUt E≈øtraungers to fines (which be all per≈øons not parties nor priuies) Sect. 183. and being void of impediments naturall & legall, hauing pre≈øent right to the lands in the fine, haue onely fiue yeares after proclamations, to enter & claime their right, 1. R. 3. ca. 7. 4. H. 7. ca. 24.

As if one haue a Remainder, or a Reuer≈øion, depending vpon an Tenant in remainder or reuer≈øion vpon e≈øtate for yeares, or at will. e≈øtate for yeares, or by ≈øtatute Staple, ≈øtatute Marchant, or Elegit, and the termor be di≈ø≈øei≈øed, and a fine leuied &c. and fiue yeares pa≈ø≈øed, they be all barred thereby: for that the≈øe Termors might pre≈øently haue entred, & he in the Reuer≈øioÃÑ or Remainder for ≈øuch di≈ø≈øei≈øin might haue had an A≈ø≈øi≈øe: So that Statute 4. H. 7. ca. 24. ≈øeemeth to barre the termors through negligence, by this woord intere≈øt, which comprehendeth a terme. Plow. fol. 374. a.

And if a tenant in taile be di≈ø≈øei≈øed, and a fine leuied with proclamation, and fiue yeares pa≈øt, and the tenant in taile dieth, thi≈ø≈øue in tayle is bound for euer, per Dyer and Catlyn, for the right was pre≈øent to the tenant in taile at the time of the fine leuied, and he can not claime, but by the ≈øame title, which his father had, which was barred in his life time, Plow. fol. 374. a. Dyer fol. 3. p. 6. 19. H. 8. 7. The like it is of the laches of him in the remainder or reuer≈øion, for it barreth him and his heires, Plow. fol: 374. a. Dyer fo. 3. p. 6.

div.head: Of E≈øtrangers hauing pre≈øent Right and impediments.
div.p: BUt e≈øtraungers to fines, pe≈øtered with impediments, of Infancy, Sect. 184. couerture, madnes, ideocy, lunacy, impri≈øonment, or ab≈øence out of the Realme at the leuying of fines, and hauing then pre≈øent right, or intere≈øt, haue yet libertie fiue yeares, after ≈øuch infirmitie remoued, to make entrie, or claime, &c. 1. R. 3. ca. 7. 4. H. 7. ca. 24.

And therfore an Infant hath fiue yeares, after he accompli≈øh his full Infants. age (though he be in his mothers woÃÑbe) Plow. 367. a. becau≈øe the law intendeth that Infants by rea≈øon of their tender yeres, do want vnder≈øtanding, to know their right, & whether their entries be lawfull or no, And how to make their entries and claime, or bring their actions, according to their title, Plow. fol. 359. b. 4. H. 7. ca. 24.

Yet if my fathers brother di≈ø≈øei≈øe him, and leauie a fine with proclamation, and a yeare after the proclamation my father dieth, And after, and within fiue yeares, my vutle dieth, I by rea≈øon of mine Infancy haue onely ≈øo much time to auoid the ≈øame, as at the death of my father remained to come of the fiue yeares next after the proclamation, & not new fiue yeares, becau≈øe I claime by the ≈øame title that my father had in whom the fir≈øt fiue yeares were attached and begun, Dyer fol. 3. p. 2. In like maner, and for the ≈øame rea≈øon, if the father, or other aunce≈øter, be di≈ø≈øei≈øed, and the di≈ø≈øei≈øor leuie a fine with proclamation, and within fiue yeares after the proclamation, the aunce≈øter dieth, his heire being within age, yet if he make not his entrie, or claime, within the fir≈øt fiue yeares after the proclamation, he is barred, Plow. fol. 367. b. 377. a. As it is there adiudged.

Mad men, and lunatiques, e≈øtrangers to fines, haue the like libertie, Non ≈øane memoriae. to enter, or claime, that Infants haue for their indi≈øcretion, 1. R. 3. c. 7. 4. H. 7. ca. 24. Yet, as it ≈øeemeth, if non ≈øanitie of memorie happen after ye fine leuied, and before the la≈øt proclamation to be made, the parties be not tied to make claime or entrie, during the fir≈øt fiue yeares, but ≈øhal haue fiue yeares after they be cured of their ≈øaid maladies, becau≈øe they grow by the act of God, Plow fol. 375. a. & 366. a.

And a Feme couert, being an e≈øtranger to a fine, hath fiue yeares, after Couerture. ≈øhe be di≈øcouert, to pur≈øue her right, for that during the couerture,
≈øhe wanted power to do the ≈øame without her hu≈øbands con≈øent, who perchance would neither do it, nor ≈øuffer it to be done: Howbeit if a Feme ≈øole being an e≈øtranger to a fine, and haue pre≈øent right &c. take a hu≈øband, who ≈øuffereth the fiue yeares to incurre, ≈øhe is thereby barred for euer, becau≈øe it was her owne voluntarie act and follie to marrie ≈øuch an hu≈øband. Plowd. fol. 366. a.

E≈øtraÃÑgers to fines, impri≈øoned at the time of the fine leuied, haue the Impri≈øonmÃÑt. like liberty to auoid fines, that Infants haue, becau≈øe the law inteÃÑdeth, that pri≈øoners are ≈øo clo≈øely & ≈øtraictly kept from the conference of others, that they know not, what happeneth abroad, And do al≈øo want libertie to take coun≈øaile, & make their entrees & claimes, & therfore no laches is in this behalf imputed to them. Plo. f. 360. a. & 366. a. But if ≈øuch impri≈øonment happen after the fine leuied, before the la≈øt proclamatioÃÑ made, it ≈øeemeth he ≈øhal haue 5. yeares after his enlargement, becau≈øe thimpri≈øonment is not his voluntary act. Plow. 375. a. 366. a.

An E≈øtrÃÑ to a fine, being out of the realm, at the leuying thereof, hath Out of England. 5. yeares after his returne to enter or claime, But if he had bin in England at the leuying of the fine & after had gone beyond the ≈øeas, and ≈øuffered the 5. yeares after proclamation to pa≈ø≈øe, he had bene barred. Plo. f. 366. a. 7. Eliz. 4. H. 7. ca. 24. But if he be ≈øent beyond the ≈øeas in the kings ≈øeruice by his commandement, it ≈øeemeth otherwi≈øe.

And ≈øuch ciuil bodies or corporatioÃÑs, as haue in them≈øelues ab≈øolute Corporations. e≈øtate and authoritie of their po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈ø ≈øo as they may maintaine a writ of Right thereof, as, Maior & CoÃÑminaltie, Deane & chapter, colledges, ≈øocieties incorporate, & ≈øuch like, they and their ≈øucce≈ø≈øors, are barred by fine and nonclaime by 5. yeares. Plo. f. 538. T. 20. Eliz.

But, Deanes, Bi≈øhops, Priors, Abbots, Ma≈øters of ho≈øpitals, Par≈øons, Corporations. vicars, prebendaries, chauntrie prie≈øts, and ≈øuch like, hauing ioint power, and which may not haue a writ of Right, but either a Iuris vtrum, Fitz. Nat. f. 48. r. or, fine a≈ø≈øen≈øu capituli, Fitz. Nat. f. 118. i. are not barred by ≈øuch fines, and nonclaime by 5. yeares. Plow. 538. a. 20. Eliz. 375. b. 11. Eliz.

div.head: Of E≈øtrangers hauing diuers defects,
div.p: ANd moreouer, e≈øtrangers to fines, hauing diuers defects or in≈øirmities, Sect. 185. as infaÃÑcy couerture, non ≈øanitie of memory, impri≈øonmeÃÑt, ab≈øence out of the realme, to auoid fines, mu≈øt haue 5. yeares after the la≈øt of the ≈øaid infirmities remoued. Plow. 375. a.

But if they haue diuers impedimeÃÑts, which be al, once after the Íùìclation, wholy remoued, & after, they fall into the like againe, and die, their heires are not to haue new 5. yeres, but the fir≈øt 5. yeres, begun in their aunce≈øters, immediatly after their fir≈øt impediments ≈øo remoued, ≈øhall proceed, and non clayme of their heires, during all the re≈øidue of the
≈øaid fiue yeares, bindeth them, as their ≈øaid aunce≈øters ≈øhould haue bene bound thereby, if they had remained void of ≈øuch impediments during all the ≈øame fiue yeares, Plow. f. 375. a

div.head: Of E≈øtrangers, without impediments, hauing future Right for cau≈øe precedent.
div.p: THus much of E≈øtrangers to fines, hauing pre≈øent right: now of Sect. 186. ≈øuch, as haue future right, which right is of two ≈øorts: for it groweth, eyther wholy before the proclamation, or, partly before and partly after the ≈øame.

And therefore E≈øtrÃÑ to fines, voide of the ≈øaid impediments, who≈øe right, title, claime, or, intere≈øt, fir≈øt groweth, remaineth, di≈øcendeth, or, commeth to them, after the proclamation, by force of any matter or cau≈øe had or made before the ≈øame, haue only fiue yeares, after that ≈øuch right &c. fir≈øt groweth, di≈øcendeth, remaineth, or commeth vnto them. 1. R. 3. ca. 7. 4. H. 7. ca. 24. As if a Morgagee be di≈ø≈øei≈øed, and the di≈ø≈øei≈øor doth leuie a fine with Proclamation, and the fiue yeares after the proclamation the morgageour paieth or tendreth the money according to his bargaine, he may lawfully enter at any time within fiue yeares after the ≈øaid payment or tender, becau≈øe his title fir≈øt accrueth thereby after the proclamation, by rea≈øon of the coÃÑdition and morgage made before the ≈øame. Plow. fol. 378. a. b.

In like maner, and for the like cau≈øe, he, which hath a Remainder or reuercion, depending vpon an e≈øtate of freehold, hath fiue yeares, after that his remainder or reuercion e≈øcheweth, to enter &c. And his heire, if he die before entree &c. hath onely fiue yeres, after the death of the particuler tenant, to enter. Plow. fol. 374. a. b.

And if the tenant in tayle leuie a fine with proclamatioÃÑ, after y‚Ä¢ fiue yeares he dieth without i≈ø≈øue, the donor hath fiue yeares after his death, to bring his formedon in Reuerter becau≈øe he is the fir≈øt, vnto whome the right commeth after the proclamation for cau≈øe precedent. Plow. fol. 374. b.

And if tenant in taile di≈øcontinew in fee, and the di≈øcontinuee leuieth a fine with &c. and fiue yeares do pa≈ø≈øe, and the tenant in taile dieth, yet his i≈ø≈øue hath fiue yeares after his death to bring his formedon in di≈øcender, becau≈øe he is the fir≈øt to whom the right of the entaile commeth after the proclamation, by force of the guifte in taile made before the fine. Plow. 374. a. 19. H. 8. 7. Dyer f. 3. p. 5.

div.head: Of E≈øtrangers with Impediments hauing future Right.
div.p:
ANd E≈øtrangers to fines, hauing future right for any cau≈øe precedent Sect. 187. the fine, being affected with ≈øuch impediments, when their right fir≈øt accreweth haue fiue yeares after ≈øuch impedimeÃÑts remoued, to pur≈øue for the ≈øame. 1. R. 3. c. 7. 4. H. 7. c. 24. As Infants, a≈øwel tho≈øe
which be borne, as tho≈øe which be in their mothers wombe, when ≈øuch right happeneth to them. Plo. fo. 367. a. Femes couert, madmen, Lunatiques, pri≈øoners, per≈øons beyond the Sea, as appeareth before where it is ≈øpoken of them hauing pre≈øent right. Plo. 366. a. 7. Eliz.

As if a man haue i≈ø≈øue a ≈øonne and a daughter, which ≈øonne purcha≈øeth lands and dieth. And the daughter entreth as his heire, and is di≈ø≈øei≈øed by A. who leuieth a fine, and fiue yeres pa≈ø≈øe without claime. And x. yeres after the father hath an other ≈øonne, which is heire to his brother, h ‚Ä¢ ≈øhal haue new v. yeres after he come to his full age, becau≈øe he is the fir≈øt to whom the right di≈øcended after the proclamation, by rea≈øon of the di≈øcent which was before them, Plo. fo. 374. b.

But if an e≈øtranger to a fine, to whom a Remainder, or other title, fir≈øt accrueth after the fine, doe not pur≈øue his right within v. yeres, he and his i≈ø≈øue are barred for euer, 19. H. 8. Dyer fo. 3. pl. 6.
And in like maner, if the fir≈øt i≈ø≈øue in taile, to whom the title of the intaile fir≈øt accrueth, neglect his v. yeres, the whole e≈øtate taile is thereby bound for euer, 32. H. 8. Br. Fines 100.

If he, which abaceth after the death of a tenant in fee, make a feoffement vpon condition, & the feoffee leuie a fine, and v. yeres after proclamation pa≈ø≈øe without entrie or claime made by his heire, the heire is barred: But if afterwards, the condition be broken, and the Abator therefore enter, then the heire may haue an A≈ø≈øi≈øe of mortdaunce≈øter again≈øt thabator, or entrie vpon him at any time, and he hath no defence. For if he plede in barre of the a≈ø≈øi≈øe the fine leuied to the cogni≈øee, and that he hath his e≈øtate, the ≈øpeciall matter of the abatement, condition, and reentrie, may be pleaded in defe≈øance thereof, for he can neuer challenge priuiledge by the ≈øtate of the cogni≈øor, which he him≈øelfe defeated, Plo. fol. 358. b. 7. Eliz.

div.head: Of E≈øtrangers hauing no right for any cau≈øe before the fine.
div.p: BVt e≈øtrangers to fines, hauing neither pre≈øent, nor future right &c. Sect‚ñ™ 188. at the leuying thereof, by rea≈øon of any matter had before the fine, who≈øe right groweth either intirely after the Proclamation, or partly before and partly after, may enter or claime, when they plea≈øe, within the time of the pre≈øcription.

As if the father die ≈øei≈øed, his elde≈øt ≈øonne being profe≈ø≈øed, and the yonger ≈øonne entreth, and is di≈ø≈øei≈øed, and a fine with proclamation leuied, and after the elder ≈øonne is deraigned, it ≈øeemeth he is bound to no time, Plow. fo. 373. a.

So if the hu≈øband leuy a fine of his owne landes, whereof his wife is Dowe ‚Ä¢
dowable, and die, and fiue yeres pa≈ø≈øe after his death ≈øhe is not barred of her dower, becau≈øe her title to be endowed accrueth after the fine leuied,
namely by the death of her hu≈øband, for before his death, ≈øhe had onely a po≈ø≈øibility of dower, and not any right, title, or intere≈øt thereunto, Plo. fol. 373. a.

And if a tenant cea≈øe one yeare, and then a fine with proclamation is leuied, And afterwards a tenant cea≈øeth another yere, The Lord may haue his ce≈ø≈øauit perbiennium xx. yeres after the Proclamation made, becau≈øe his right and title groweth partly before the fine, & partly after the fine leuied, that is at the end of the two yeres of his tenants cea≈ø≈øer, Plo. fo. 373. b.

div.head: Of E≈øtrangers hauing diuer≈øe future Rights, by diuer≈øe titles.
div.p: BVt if E≈øtrangers to fines, haue ≈øeueral future Rights, by diuers titles Sect‚ñ™ 189. growing at ≈øeueral times, it ≈øeemeth, that they ≈øhall haue ≈øeuerall fiue yeres, to make entrie or claime, commencing from ≈øuch time as their ≈øeueral titles fir≈øt accrewe vnto them: As if tenant for life, the remainder in fee, make a feoffement in fee. And the feoffee leuy a fine with &c. and he in the Remainder ≈øuffer the fir≈øt fiue yeres to pa≈ø≈øe, he is by his laches barred of his entrie, for the forfaiture growing by the alienation of his tenant during his tenant for life, becau≈øe he had pre≈øent right at the leuying of the fine to enter for the ≈øame, yet if after the tenant for life do die, he hath other v. yeres, to bring his Formedon in Remainder, becau≈øe that is a n ‚Ä¢ we title or right, by which hee coulde not haue his Formedon during his tenant for life, And he had his election to take aduantage of the forfaiture or not, Plo. fo. 373. b. Quere, for there Catlyn thinketh otherwi≈øe, becau≈øe his title to the land by the forfaiture accrued to him in the life time of his tenant for life.

If I. S. be tenant Pur auter vie, the Remainder to an other for life, the remainder to the ≈øame I. S. in fee, and I. S. is di≈ø≈øei≈øed, and the di≈ø≈øei≈øor leuieth a fine with proclamation, and the fiue yeres pa≈ø≈øe, I. S. is bound for his future and pre≈øent e≈øtate for life: But if ce≈øtuy que vie, and he in the meane remainder die, now, I. S. ≈øhal haue other fiue yeres, to enter for his remainder in fee, for it then fir≈øt remaineth vnto him by the death of him in the meane Remainder, & ce≈øtuy que vie, for cau≈øe growen wholy before the fine, that is, the ≈øtate ≈øo made before, which is an other title, Plowden 367. b. per Wel≈øhe, and diuers Iu≈øtices, Plow. 367. b.

In like maker, if land: be giuen to I. S. for the life of A. the remainmainder to him for the life of B. the remainder to him for the life of C. and he is di≈ø≈øei≈øed, & the di≈ø≈øei≈øor leuieth a fine with proclamation, now I. S. for his pre≈øent right, hath v. yeres by the fir≈øt Sauing of the StatÃÑ. 4. H. 7. cap. 24. And v. yeres after the death of A. by the ≈øeconde Sauing, which is of future right, and other v. yeres after the death of B. for his
≈øecond remainder, for quando duo iura in vna per≈øona concurrunt, aequum e≈øt, ac ≈øi e≈ø≈øent in diuer≈øis, Plo. 368. a.

If a man di≈ø≈øei≈øe a feme ≈øole, and after marry her, and haue i≈ø≈øue by her, & the baron is di≈ø≈øei≈øed before mariage or after, and a fine with proclamation leuied, fir≈øt the baron, & after the feme, die within the v. yeres, the i≈ø≈øue being of full age, the v. yeres pa≈ø≈øe, he is there by bound, as heire to his father, but hath other v. yeres, after the death of his mother, to enter, for albeit it is but one ≈øelfe ≈øame lande, yet the heire hath ≈øeueral rights thereunto, growing at ≈øeuerall times, thone as heire to his father, thother as heire to his mother, in regarde whereof he hath ≈øeuerall times, Plow. 367. b.

So if the hu≈øband maketh a feoffement of his wiues lands vpon condition, which is broken, he leuieth a fine with &c. the hu≈øband hath i≈ø≈øue by his wife, and dieth, the fir≈øt v. yeres pa≈ø≈øe, and then the wife dieth, the heire is barred of his entrie for the condition as heire to his father, but ≈øhal haue v. yeres after the death of his father, to claime &c. becau≈øe it is a title differing from that which did di≈øcend from his father, accrueing to him fir≈øt by the death of his mother, Plo. 367. a.

div.head: Estrangers to fines, hauing neither pre≈øent, nor future right, to the tenements in the fine, at the leuying thereof, but onely vnto rents, common, &c. i≈ø≈øuing out of the ≈øame.
div.p: ANd E≈øtrangers to fines, hauing neither pre≈øent, nor future right to Sect‚ñ™ 190‚ñ™ the tenements in the fine, but vnto ≈øome thing, in, or, i≈ø≈øuing out of the ≈øame, ≈øeeme not barrable at all, by any ≈øuch fine & nonclaime. As if a tenant in Auncient deme≈ø ‚Ä¢ e leuy a fine with &c. at the common law, of his lands in auncient deme≈ø ‚Ä¢ e, the Lord in auncient deme≈ø ‚Ä¢ e may haue his writ of Deceipt, and thereby auoid the fine at any time, & thereupon his tenant ≈øhalbe re≈øtored to the land, becau≈øe the Lord claimeth not the land, whereof the fine is leuied, but his auncient Seigniory and ≈øeruices i≈ø≈øuing out of the ≈øame, Plo. 370. b.

It ≈øeemeth, ≈øuch fines doe not barre ≈øuch e≈øtrangers, as haue rent, coÃÑ mon, way, e≈øtouers, or any ≈øuch charge out of the land, for it ≈øeemeth that the≈øe fines extend onely to binde the ≈øtate, title, right, claime, entrie and intere≈øt, in, and to the land, and no profits to be taken out of the lands, nor to take power giuen to executors or others to ≈øell the land. Brooke titÃÑ Fines 123.

div.head: Pleas to a ‚Ä¢ oide Fines.
div.p:
IT is a good plea to ≈øay, that I. S. was ≈øei≈øed tempore leuac', and before Sect‚ñ™ 191. the fine leuied, without that that the parties to the fine, had any
thing therein at the time o ‚Ä¢ the fine leuied, 9. H. 4. 27. 3. H. 6. 27.

Or to ≈øay, that the parties to a fine had nothing &c. but A. B. who≈øe e≈øtate he hath. Et de hoc ponit ≈øe ≈øuper priÃÑam, 33. H. 6. 18. 26. H. 6. f. 9. 42. E. 3. 20. 4. H. 4. 8. 14. H. 4. 33. 4. H. 7. ca. 24.

If there be two R. D. of one name, & the one leuy a fine of the land of thother, thother may auoid the fine by pleading that there be two of one name, and thother K. D. leuied the fine, and not he: And in like maner if any e≈øtranger, leuie a fine in the name of another, that is owner of the land, 34. H. 6. 19. ContrÃÑ tenÃÑ 19. H. 6. 44. becau≈øe it is a matter of recorde, therefore hath no other remedie in ≈øuch ca≈øe but an action of di≈øceit.

Neither parties to fines, nor their heires, may pleade in auoidance thereof, that before the leuying, and at the leuying of the ≈øame, & ≈øince, the demaundant, or plaintife, or their heires, were alwaies ≈øei≈øed of the lands conteined in the fine, or, of parcel thereof. StatÃÑ de finibus 27. E. 1. ca. 1. 12. E. 4, 15 & 19. yet by Fairefax, if tenant in taile, the remainder in fee, leuie a fine ≈øur cogni≈øance de droit come ceo &c. hee in the remainder, may auerre the continuance of po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, notwith≈øtanding the fine and ≈øtatute, becau≈øe he is neither the partie, nor his heire, and ≈øo may a Feme couert, where her hu≈øbande ≈øole leuieth the fine, 12. E. 4. 12.

The i≈ø≈øue in taile may auerre continuance of po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion again≈øt a fine ≈øur cogni≈øance de droit tantum, or ≈øurrender, but not again≈øt a fine ≈øur cogni≈øance de droit come ceo que il ad de ≈øon done, becau≈øe that fine is executed, and the other executorie, 12. E. 4. 15. & 19. 11. H. 4. 85.

div.head: Of a writ of Error.
div.p: A Writ of Error to reuer≈øe a fine, lieth where there is Error in any Sect' 192. fine, and thereby not the record of the fine it ≈øelfe ≈øhalbe remoued, but the tran≈øcript thereof, vpon which tran≈øcript of the note of the fine, the plaintife may a≈ø≈øigne his errors: And if the Iu≈øtices thinke, that the point a≈ø≈øigned for error, is error, they may ≈øend for the note of the fine, & reuer≈øe the ≈øame, Fitz. nat. fo. 20. f. As if baron and feme leuie a fine to an e≈øtraunger, the feme being within age, they may haue a writ of error to reuer≈øe the fine, for this cau≈øe during her nonage, Fitz. nat. 21. d. 27. a≈ø≈ø. pl. 17. 50. E. 3. 4. And when a fine is to be reuer≈øed by error, the cour≈øe is for the plaintife in the writ, to haue ≈øeueral writs of Error, one directed vnto the chiefe Iu≈øtice of the court of Common plees to certifie the record & proces of the fine, another vnto the Cu≈øtos br. of the ≈øame court to certifie the tran≈øcript of the foote of the fine, and the third vnto the Chirographer to certifie the tran≈øcript of the record and proces of the fine: the ≈øeueral formes whereof be, as followeth.

And note that a writ of Error, is not maintenable by an Infant, to reuer≈øe
a fine for his Infancy, but during his Infancy, 50. E. 3. 4. 17. E. 3. 52. 78. 27. Lib. a≈ø≈ø. 53.

For what Errors, ≈øines and proclamations be not reuer≈øable. No ≈øines, or proclamations vpon ≈øines, or coÃÑmon recoueries, ≈øhalbe reuer≈øable by writ of Error, for fal≈øe or incongruous latin, razure, interlining, mi≈øentring of any warrant of atturney, or of any proclamation, mi≈øretorning or not returning of the ≈øherife, or other want of forme‚ñ™ in words & not of matter of ≈øub≈øtance, 23. Eliz. ca. 3.
div.q: Of Error in the proclamation of a fine.
div.p: If Error be in the procalmations of a fine, they ≈øhall be reuer≈øed by plea without writ of error, but that fine neuertheles remaineth of good force ≈øtil, for they are ≈øeueral matters of record, yet if error be in the fine, the proclamations are void, becau≈øe the fine is the fir≈øt record whereupon the proclamations depend, & ≈øublato ≈øubiecto tollitur eius accidens, Plow. 266. a. Dyer fol. 216. p. 54. 4. Eliz.

div.head: Of a Cerciorari.
div.p: IF a man haue recouered, and before he haue execution, the Recordes Sect' 193. therof be remoued into the receit or Trea≈øory, the plaintife may haue a Cerciorari our of the Chancery to the Chamberlaine & Trea≈øorer, to remoue the tenour of the Recorde and proce≈ø≈øe thence into the Chauncerie, And when it is there, it may be ≈øent thence by Mittimus into the Court whence it came, as the Kings bench, if it came thence: or into the common Place, if it came thence, and there may execution be ≈øued, 37. H. 6. 16.
A Certiorari with a Mittimus, to remoue a fine, bearing date before the fine come into the Chancerie, is good enough, 1. R. 3. 4.

In a writ of Error to reuer≈øe a fine, the Record it ≈øelfe ≈øhall not be remoued, but the tran≈øcript thereof, becau≈øe a record, which commeth into the K. bench, ≈øhal not be remaunded: And if the iudgement be affirmed, there is no Chirographer to ingro≈ø≈øe the fine, 40. a≈ø≈ø. 19. 29. a≈ø≈ø. 43.

Yet 5. Marie, it is holden that in a writ of Error vpon a fine, the record it ≈øelfe ≈øhalbe certified, ≈øo that no mo proclamatioÃÑs ≈øhal be made thereupon, for if it be reuer≈øed, that endeth all: And if the fine be affirmed, the record ≈øhalbe ≈øent into the common place by Mittimus, to be proclaimed and ingro≈ø≈øed: For if the tran≈øcript only ≈øhould be remoued, they might neuerthele≈ø≈øe proceede in the common place, Br. TitÃÑ Recorde 79. Ideo quere.

div.head: Whether any but he, which reuer≈øeth a fine, may reape benefit thereby.
div.p: IF the e≈øtate, con ‚Ä¢ eined i ‚Ä¢ a fine, be once within fi ‚Ä¢ e yeares after proclamations Sect. 196. lawfully defeated, That partie hath thereby lo≈øt his whole e≈øtate both again≈øt him which did reuer≈øe the ≈øame, and all others which had right or title peramont, and made no claime within the fiue yeares: Al ‚Ä¢ eit he which brought his action haue not iudgement & execution within 7. yeares after the proclamations, P ‚Ä¢ o. fol. 358. b.

In like maner if there b ‚Ä¢ tenant for life, the remainder for life, the remainder in fee, & the fir≈øt tenaÃÑt for life alien, & the alienee leuie a fine with proclamations, & the ≈øecond tenant for life enter or claime (as he may) he defeateth the fine again≈øt him≈øelfe, and him in the remainder al≈øo, Plowd. fol. 359. a. 7. Eliz.

div.head: Warrantia chartae.
div.p:
A Writ of Warrantia charte, lie ‚Ä¢ h where a man by deed of graunt,
Sect. 197. feoffement, releas, or confirmation, or fine, or by exchange, bindeth him≈øelfe and his heires to warrant the lande to an other, who beyng tenant of the land is impleaded for the land, or rent out of the ≈øame, in an A≈ø≈øi≈ø ‚Ä¢ , or writ of „Äà‚óä„Äâ in „Äà‚óä„Äâ of an A≈ø≈øi ‚Ä¢ e, or in a Scire facias vpoÃÑ a fine, or in any other action reall, wherein the tenant may not vouch, he may ≈øue a Warrantia chartae, again≈øt him, & his heirs which made warrantie. And for a tenant by homage aunce≈øtrel, or any particuler tenant vpon re≈øeruation of rent, or for egalty of ≈øeruices vpon particion, Fitz. Nat. f. 1 ‚Ä¢ 4. d. f. g. h. Fitz. Nat. 135. e. 31. E. 3. 8. E. 4. 11.

Rex &c‚ñ™ quod iu≈øte &c. wa ‚Ä¢ antizet D. vnu ‚Ä¢ fi me≈ø≈øuagium cum Íùëtinentijs Briefe de Warrantia chartae. in R. qd' tenet, & d ‚Ä¢ eo t ‚Ä¢ nere cla ‚Ä¢ nat, & vnde chartam ≈øuam habet vt dicit. Et ≈øi &c. vel ≈øic. Manerium de N. cum pertinentiis, & aduocationem eiu≈ødem villae, quae tenet &c. v≈øque ibi, vnde chartaÃÑ ≈øuam habet, vel chartam R. patris, vel matris, vel alterius antece≈ø≈øoris praedicti H. cuius haeres ip≈øe e≈øt, vt dicit. Et ni≈øi &c. vel
De eo quod idem A. wa ‚Ä¢ antizet praefato D. maneria de N. & K. & hundreda de F. et G. cum pertinentijs, & aduocationem Eccle≈øiae de N. & ideo vobis mandamus &c.

But if a man in feoffe an other with warrantie by ‚Ä¢ eede, and the feoffee infeoffe an other, and take e≈øtate from him in fee, the fir≈øt warrantie is determined, becau≈øe he is now in of a new e≈øtate, Fitz. nat. fol. 135. a.

So if A. di≈ø≈øei≈øe B. and infeoffe C. with warrantie, who infeoffeth D. with warrantie, vpon whom an e≈øtranger e ‚Ä¢ treth, in wh ‚Ä¢ ≈øe po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion B. the di≈ø≈øei≈øor relea≈øeth his right, now all former warranties are extinct: And albeit D. is impleaded, yet ≈øhall he not haue Warrantia chartae, becau≈øe he is in of an other e≈øtate by wrong, Fitz. nat. 135. g. 21. H. 6. 41. 22. H. 6. 22.

If there be three IointenaÃÑts, and thone relea≈øe to the re≈øt, they may
Releas per Iointenants. deraigne the former warrantie by voucher, or Warrantia chartae, for they be in a third part by the relea≈øe, 40. E. 3. 41.
Warrantia chartae lyeth again≈øt a villein, 48. E. 3. 17. Villenage.

The writ of WarrÃÑ cha ‚Ä¢ tae mu≈øt be ≈øued haÃÑging the principal plea, & before iudgement: as of A≈øsi≈øe, or Entre in nature of a≈ø≈øi≈øe, 48. E. 3. 22. div.head: SYMBOLEOGRAPHY, Of Recoueries for A≈ø≈øurances &c. called common, or feigned Recoueries.
div.p: IN euery Recouerie are to be regarded the demandant,Sectio 1. the tenant of the land, & the vouchee, as the efficient cau≈øes thereof. The land demaunded, as the matter which mu≈øt as certeinly be ≈øet downe in writs of Entre, as in writs of Couenant, whereupon fines are leuied. The end and effect of ≈øuch recoueries, is to di≈øcontinue and di≈øtroy e≈øtates tailes, remainders, and reuer≈øions, and baire the former owners thereof.
The Demaundant is he that bringeth the writ of Entre, and may be termed the Recouerer.
The Tenant is he, again≈øt whom the writ is brought, and may be termed the Recoueree.
The Vouchee is he, whom the tenaÃÑt voucheth, or calleth to warranty for the land in demaund.

And ≈øuch per≈øons may be demaundants, tenants, and vouchees, in the≈øe recoueries, as may be Cognizors and Cognizees, in writs of Couenant, and by ≈øuch names, Mutatis mutandis. Sauing that if any recouery be had again≈øt any tenant in taile, the reuer≈øion or remainder being in the Queene, of the gift of the Queene, or of any of her Maie≈øties progenitors, kings of England: ≈øuch recouerie will neither barre the i≈ø≈øue in taile of his Entre, nor di≈øcontinue his e≈øtate, nor pluck ≈øuch reuer≈øion or remainder out of her Maie≈øtie, 34. H. 8. cap. 20. Quaere tamen ≈øi tiel recouerie barre li≈ø≈øue in taile, during the continuance of the e≈øtate taile, Dyer fol. 132. pla. 1.

Item before ≈øuch per≈øons, by ≈øuch meanes, and in ≈øuch maner may warrants of Attorney bee knowledged and certified, as fines knowledged in the Countrie: ≈øauing that the recognizance of warrants of Attorney may be taken by any Iu≈øtice or Seriant, without a writ of Dedimus pote≈øtatem. And fines mu≈øt be paied vpon writs of Entre, as vpon writs of Couenant. And all ≈øuch writs of Entre mu≈øt be ≈øigned by the Queenes Atturney before they can be ≈øealed.

In a Recouerie with double voucher, the fine mu≈øt bt ≈øued fir≈øt to make him tenant at the time of the writ of Entre brought, for euery writ of Entre mu≈øt alwaies be brought again≈øt him that is tenaÃÑt of the freehold of the land demauÃÑded at the time of the writ brought, 18. R. 2.
and Dyer fol. 252. pla. 98. for that, that the e≈øtate of the tenant in taile which is vouchee, is barred in re≈øpect of the a≈ø≈øets only which is, or may be recouered in value. Plow. Ba≈ø≈øet vers Manxel fol. 11. a, and of execution ≈øued by the tenant again≈øt him.

And if the tenant haue but an e≈øtate for life, or in dower, or by the curte≈øie: then to haue a good recouerie thereof, it is meete that ≈øuch tenant make a conditional Surrender of his e≈øtate to him in the reuer≈øion, or remainder, to the end he may be a perfect tenant of the inheritance, and then to bring the writ of Entre again≈øt him: And after that the recouery is executed, the particuler tenant for breach of the condition may enter and inioy his terme, notwith≈øtanding ≈øuch ≈øurrender.

p.hi: See the like Surrender in the Chapter of Surrenders, in the fir≈øt part of Symboleography.

div.head: Of what things a writ of Entre lieth not.
div.p:
PRaecipe quod reddat lieth not, de fo≈ø≈øato, nec de ≈øtagno, nee de pi≈øcaria Sect' 3.
8. E. 3. 381. nec de deaduocatione, decimarum vnius carucatÃÑ tÃÑre, Regi≈øtrÃÑ fo. 29. nec de coÃÑmunia pa≈øturÃÑ 27. H. 8, f. 12. de e≈øtouerijs 2. E. 3. de homagio & fidelitatÃÑ, nec de ≈øeruitijs faciendis 6. E. 2.

A Praecipe quod reddat lieth not de bouatÃÑ mari≈øci 13. E. 3. fo. 3. de ≈øelione terre E. 1. for the incerteintie, becau≈øe a Selon which is a lande, ≈øomtime conteineth an acre, ≈øometime halfe an acre, ≈øometime more, and ≈øometimes le≈ø≈øe, It lieth not of a garden, cottage, or croft, 14. a≈ø≈ø. 13. 8. H. 6. 3. 22. E. 4. 13. de virgata terre 41. 43. 13. E. 3. defodina, de minera, de mercatu, 13. E. 3. for they lie not in Deme≈øne, but in Gaine, nec de ≈øuperiori camera 3. H. 6. fo. 1.

A writ of Entre ought not to contein one ≈øelfe thing twi≈øe, as a me≈ø≈øuage, & a hou≈øe parcel of the ≈øame me≈ø≈øuage, 2. Ed. 4. fol. 28. 46. E. 3. fo. 26. Nor to name a Towne and a Hamlet within the ≈øame towne, 22. E. 3 fol. 14. 41. Ed. 3. fol. 22.
In euery warrant of Atturney it is good to put 2. Atturneis at the lea≈øt for feare of death.
In a countie Palantine, as Lanca≈øter, Duri≈øme, Che≈øter &c. may bee put in a warrant one Atturney, and one of the Iu≈øtices Clarkes.

If the writ of Entre be returnable Cra≈øtino Martini, the writ of Summons ad warrÃÑ thereupon mu≈øt beare Te≈øte from the returne of Cra≈øtino Martini, and be returnable ix. Returnes after the returne of the writ of Entre inclu≈øiue: that is accompting Cra≈øtino Martini for one of the ix. returnes, and tres Pa≈øchae, which is the ninth returne after Cra≈øtino Martini for another. And the Te≈øte of the writ of Sei≈øin mu≈øt be the day of that ninth returne, and be returnable xv. daies after. Then the writ of Sei≈øin may be returned, that ≈øei≈øin was deliuered by vertue therof to the demandant, by the ≈øherife of the Countie where the lands lie vpon any day (not being Sunday) betweene the Te≈øte and returne of the ≈øaid writ of Sei≈øin. Then the writs of Entre, Summons, and Sei≈øin mu≈øt be returned and filed with the Cu≈øtos breuium, & the iudgement entred by the preignotary, & the warrants of Atturney by the Clark of the warrants.
If a ≈øingle recouery and a fine be again≈øt the tenant, the writ of Entre mu≈øt beare date and Te≈øte, before the writ of Couenant, and be returned before.

If a writ of Couenant be brought again≈øt the tenant, and a writ of Entre again≈øt the demaundant: then the writ of Couenant mu≈øt beare date, and be returned before the writ of Entre, and this is called a double voucher.

p.hi: And it is to be noted, that of all licences to alien temporall land in Mortma ‚Ä¢ , the fine to the Queene is 5. yeares value of the ≈øame.
Of all licences to alien ≈øpirituall land, (as appropriations of Churches, or other benefices ≈øpirituall) the fine to the Queene is 4. yeares value thereof.
Of all licences of alienation made of lands holden of the Queene in Capite, the fine is the third part of the value, the tenth deducted.
Of all pardons of alienation by the Kings tenant in Capite, the fine is one yeares value thereof.
Of all licences of Mariage of the Queenes widow, the fine is the third part of the value of her dower by a yeare.
Of all pardons of the Queenes Widowes maried without licence the fine is the whole value of her dower by a yeare.

Needham qui pre≈øens e≈øt hic in cur' in propria per≈øona ≈øua et gratis manerium me≈øuag' moleÃÑd' terr' pratÃÑ, pa≈øturÃÑ, bo≈øc', turbarÃÑ, terrÃÑ, aquaÃÑ coopertÃÑ & redditÃÑ praedictÃÑ cum pertinenÃÑ eidem W. M. warrantizat &c. Et ≈øuper hoc praedict' R. W. B. &c. petunt ver≈øus ip≈øum Th. Needham tenenÃÑ per warranÃÑ ≈øuam praedict' manerÃÑ me≈øuag' molend' terr' pratÃÑ, pa≈øtur', bo≈øc', turbar', terr', aquaÃÑ coopertÃÑ & redd' ≈øuperius petitÃÑ cum pertinenÃÑ in forma praed'. Et vnde dicunt quod ip≈øimet fuerunt ≈øei≈øitÃÑ de ei≈ødem manerÃÑ me≈øuagijs molendinÃÑ terr' pratÃÑ, pa≈øturÃÑ, bo≈øc', turbar', terr' aqua coopertÃÑ et redditÃÑ ≈øuperius petitÃÑ cum pertinentÃÑ in dominico ≈øuo vt de feodo tempore pacis, tempore dict' domini Regis nunc capiend' inde expleciones ad valenc' &c. Et in quae &c. Et inde producunt ≈øectam &c.

Et praedict' Tho. Needham tenenÃÑ per warrantÃÑ ≈øuam defendit ius ≈øuum quando &c. Et dic' quod praedict' Th. Cutte non di≈ø≈øei≈øiuit praedict' R. W. B. &c. de manerio me≈øuagio, molendino terr' pratÃÑ, pa≈øtur', bo≈øc', turbar', aqua coopertÃÑ et redditÃÑ cum pertinentÃÑ modo & forma proutijdem R. W. B. &c. per breue & narrationem ≈øuam ≈øuperius ≈øupponunt &c.

Et praedictÃÑ R. W. B. &c. petunt licenciam inde interloquendi hic &c. Et habent &c. Po≈øtea quae i≈øto eod' comÃÑ hic &c. ijdem R. W. B. &c. per praedictÃÑ AtturnatÃÑ ≈øuum reuenÃÑ in cur' domini regis &c. Et praedictÃÑ T. N. tenens per warrantÃÑ licet ≈øolempniter exactÃÑ non reuenÃÑ ≈øed in contemptum curiae hic rece≈ø≈øit et defal ‚Ä¢ fecit &c. Ideo conce≈ø≈øum e≈øt per Iudicatores comÃÑ praedictÃÑ quod praeƒë R. W. B. recuperarent ≈øei≈øinam ver≈øus praed' R. D. & T. H. depraed' manerio me≈ø≈øuagijs molendinÃÑ, terr' prat, pa≈øtur', bo≈øc', turbar', terr', aqua coopertÃÑ, redditÃÑ, ≈øuperius petitÃÑ cuÃÑ pertinentÃÑ &c. Et quod praed' R. D. & T. H. habeant de terr' praedictÃÑ W. M. ad valenc' &c. Et quod idem W. M. habeat de terris praedictÃÑ T. N. ad valenc' &c. Et idem T. N. in miÃÑa &c.
